field.name: summary
field.value: Parsing container configuration uses the current culture

field.name: description
field.value:
When parsing the XML configuration, Windsor apparently uses the current culture. For example, on computers where the current culture is Czech, doubles have to be written using comma as a decimal mark (e.g. "0,5"), while on computers that have the English culture set, decimal point has to be used (e.g. "0.5").
What this means is that it's not possible to distribute an application that uses doubles in Windsor XML configuration to computers with unknown culture settings.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: So what are you suggesting? To use Invariant culture for that?

comment.author: svick
comment.text: Yes, I think that would be the best option.
